isis.stitle: ALTERNATOR: DELCO-REMY 26-SI SERIES - REPAIR PROCEDURES - REASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: REASSEMBLY

important.para: Before installing thru-bolts, apply a small coating of thread lock adhesive (General Purpose Lock N' Seal No. 242 or equivalent) to the threads. This will prevent the bolts from backing out during operation.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 10for all Item number callouts in parentheses.

step1.para: Fasten the drive end frame (Item 52) to the rectifier end frame (Item 21) with through bolts (Item 55). Tighten thru-bolts to 55 in. lbs. (6 N•m).

caution.para: DO NOT overtighten bolt or adapter. Excessive tightening could damage the heat sink.

step1.para: Make sure the two field coil leads are connected to the regulator.

Verify placement of leads. Check that they are in the following order on each stud: two diode leads, stator lead, "R" terminal lead (on one stud only), then regulator lead and nut. Tighten all fasteners to specifications in the TORQUE CHART.
Install a new gasket (Item 6) then attach the rectifier plate (Item 5) and rectifier plate cover (Item 2).

Attach slinger (Item 54), fan (Item 56), baffle (Item 57), pulley (Item 58), washer (Item 59) and shaft nut (Item 60) to rotor shaft. To assist in tightening the drive pulley nut, a hexagon hole is provided in the end of the rotor shaft for holding with an Allen wrench. Tighten pulley nut to 70-80 lb. ft. (95-108 N•m).
Attach output terminals to alternator. Tighten to 100-110 in. lbs. (11-12 N•m). Magnetize the rotor. Refer to MAGNETIZING THE ROTOR.
To check output, connect test meters as shown in Figure 4 and test as instructed under TROUBLESHOOTING.
